description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Starzone Vanfleet and 6th siege of Iserlhon.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.

Family friendly escape game in a viking age setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints.

Vrahode - The Calteeryn Acension is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game, the second in a series of five games, designed by Jeffrey Irving. Following the initial game Age of Prophecy (2024) this massive "core box" is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players where players can choose to journey through huge multi-quest campaign that sprawls over the heights and depths of the mysterious world of Vrahode or choose one of five other modes of play as well as four difficulty levels!

The core box campaign victory condition: "Calteeryn" (the chosen one) must learn the ruhl (magic) of each crafted race in the game while facing mounting threats. This is done by journeying through the eight unique biomes of the Overlands, Underlands, and Oceans of the world of Vrahode.

Dice-based combat is enhanced by powerful skill deck building and racial abilities unique to each race. Every enemy encounter is different, with the enemy behavior deck threatening to change how the heroes must fight them each battle!

The world of Vrahode is based on a narrative first imagined in 1990 by designer Jeffrey Irving. The Vrahode series of games includes a introductory game Vrahode - Age of Prophecy and three additional expansions: The Enlightened & The Enslaved, Facing The Storm, and The False Gods' Deceit. All are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content, adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode! This game is compatible with our proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger, players can create dynamic, multi-level dungeons up to five levels deep.

—description from the publisher

Legend has it that long ago, Gah'dir the supreme mage forged a weapon known as the Scarlet Sword in order to form an alliance with Bashok the great orc king. By wielding the sword together, they created the most powerful alliance ever built among enemies and gained a power like no other. Since then, the sword has disappeared and reappeared many times over the years and it has determined the destiny of all nations time and time again.
Recently, the legendary Scarlet Sword was rediscovered, causing the most powerful leaders in all the land to seek out an ally and once again prepare for war.

In Allies, you will create and control a fantasy army by uniting two different factions of your choice. You can either use your cards to command your troops or deploy them onto the battlefield. The unique abilities of each faction can be combined to create many different synergies, so choose wisely.

Allies is a competitive two-player card game in which every move matters. It includes tactical and strategic components. Prepare your strategies well and don’t get distracted! Remember that your plans need to change constantly to anticipate your enemies’ movements as well as to disrupt them.

In the end, the army that gains control of the battlefield first claims victory!

—description from the designer

Introducing a Pokémon board game base on the Nintendo Pokémon franchise that everyone can enjoy getting and battle. Player starts the game from the starting square and becomes a Pokémon Trainer (Boys&Girls). Roll the dice in order like "Sugoroku" and proceed while following the instructions to collect Pokémon, item cards and event cards.

Collect over 200 Pokémon and challenge the awaited rival(Cards)!!The player who challenges the awaited rival and defeats it first wins.

The board game is intended for pupils from 5th to 9th grade, and it comprises of a platform with 11 examples of everyday locations toward which the children/teams have to go. On the way to the location, they resolve exercises and tasks for improving of the English language skills, through cards with activities, questions, fun facts – given by the mentor/teacher/parent that has the role of Game Guide/Maser.

This set of beautifully illustrated cards with thirteen different animals set across the four seasons offers a range of educational matching and addition-based card games. Get all ages engaged, with breath taking scenery and cute critters from around the world.

Kick off with Bearithmatic to build the largest wildlife reserve, or enjoy one of the other four classic games included in the accompanying rulebook.

Felines are causing havoc! Race against your opponents to round up four-of-a-kind. But don’t let the cat out the bag! Bring fun, excitement and lightning reflexes to your next gathering with Herding Cats, the fast-paced card grabbing game.

If you've ever played the classic game of "Signal", this is it but with a cat twist! This game is played in teams of pairs, involves a secret signal, and cat-astrophic mayhem to collect and complete their chosen cat set first! All in real-time!

Act out funny porno titles like ‘Womb Raider’ or ‘Prodzilla’ for your team mates to guess.

No talking allowed, only gestures – the ruder the better!

In this tabletop adventure you take over a gang of up to 8 cowboys or other western characters and compete against your fellow players in Dingstown. You can equip your heroes with their own character traits that make them unique in the game.
The game with German-language rules is not only suitable for skirmishes in the Wild West, but also on all other locations.

Modern Royalty is a trick-taking game for exactly six players using a standard 52-card deck plus two jokers.

In each hand the deck is dealt out and the players then bid; bids can be 1-36 in a suit or 1-25 in "anarchy."

If the winning bid is in a suit, that suit is trump and cards are ranked normally, except that aces are special and jokers are the lowest members of the trump suit. Play is fairly standard (must follow suit, not required to trump) except that the aces in the non-trump suits are assassins which kill trump cards, and the trump ace is a guard which stops one assassin.

If the winning bid is in anarchy, there is no trump suit and cards are ranked ace high to ten low, with the face cards being equal below the ten; the jokers form their own "pariah" suit. If a pariah is led to a trick no one wins it.

Scoring depends on whether the play was in a suit or in anarchy, and if in a suit each player's score depends in part on what is taken by three of the other five players. The player who won the bid must always achieve their bid in points or be penalized; if the bid was in a suit then other players who last bid that suit must also do this.

Play is to 626 points.

There is an optional rule for an extra "knife" bid which basically means that the knifing player(s) work deliberately against the winning bidder.

Home Run Derby is a simple baseball game. Each player creates a nine-member team either by rolling on a table or by choosing a real team's current starting lineup; in each case only the batting averages matter.

When a baseball player comes up to bat two dice are rolled to determine if they get a hit, sacrifice, walk, or are out. If they get a hit a roll is made on a second table to determine the outcome. Bases can be stolen, which is also resolved via dice roll.

The defending player's only decision is whether to issue an intentional walk.

Parikrama is a relaxing, yet witty travel card game. In this game, you are a solo traveler wandering through a myriad of landscapes in the pursuit of discovery, adventure and enlightenment - traversing across forests, rivers, deserts and valleys that come along your path... occasionally discovering monuments along your way to rejuvenate and pray.

There are a lot of choices to be made - taking a shorter journey can help you move faster in the game, but a longer journey can be more rewarding, additionally landing you a chance to hitch-hike on your next journey via a bullock carriage, a riverboat ferry.. or even jump on the truck to travel even faster!

Completing a journey awards you with not just points but experience as well, which will help you travel more efficiently as the game progresses. Every journey also gifts you with an inscribed tile, a lost clay tablet with mysterious symbols and patterns that unveil fantastic Parikrama routes of the ancient times! When connected carefully, these tiles yield powerful results - and the player who first joins a pattern of 9 tiles, has completed their Parikrama map and triggers the end game!

The player with the best balance of a vivid journal, the right collection of symbols and Parikrama routes gathers the most points and wins the game!

Ð¢Ð°ÐºÑ‚Ð¸Ñ‡ÐµÑÐºÐ¾Ðµ Ð›Ð¾Ñ‚Ð¾ ("Tactical Lotto"), published in Moscow (Soviet Union) 1929.

Though the game is titled as Lotto game, it is typical roll and move game about war and military tactics with separate game board with 96 stops (16 cards of 6 stops each) and additional cards with questions about each stop. The first player, who cross whole route first, wins a game.

—user summary

A strategy game for 2 players.
Try to create a sequence of 4 tiles of your color inside the inner quadrangle of the board. Tiles advance in the
familiar chess steps and may be placed on top of each other. The game has simple rules and guarantees hours of fun.
A game for developing a thinking strategy and the ability to plan moves.

—description from the publisher

Once upon a time, Hungry Monkey searched for his lost breakfast bean in the jungle. He asked the other animals for help, from Swift Sparrow to King Tiger, but they all ignored his pleas. Until Tiny Ant climbed into Tiger's ear and ordered him to help. King Tiger was scared by the voice in his ear. He commanded all animals to look for the bean, and no one dared to refuse. Eventually, Swift Sparrow found the bean, and Hungry Monkey was finally happy.

Hungry Monkey is a card game where the goal is to get rid of your hand cards and collect beans. You have animal cards both in hand and in a face-down row. You must be the first to play all your cards, first from your hand and then from your card row.

You have to play cards with the same or a higher number. You can trigger an effect with a powerful animal.

If you want to play multiple games you keep track of the scoring with Bean cards. The player with the most beans at the end of the last game wins.

—description from the publisher

Once hungry Kitty craved to eat, but sadly found no yummy meat, instead just found some weird spice, scoffed it down and paid the price. From prickling hot sensation came the grand idea for this sweet game.

Sweet & Spicy is a bluffing card game for 2-6 players and the kid-friendly variant of Spicy. Instead of Wasabi you can now play with Lemon and there is a new card in the game: The SUPER-JOKER. But the game principle remains the same.

Just like in Spicy, the cards are played face down, so you can cheat when you announce your card. But it's not just about bluffing convincingly. You can almost always play a card that is at least half right if you play it skillfully from your hand. It's a matter of tactically considering which card you can get away with: Do I play a "pepper 9" better than a "chili 10" or a suit joker than a "pepper 10"? Or do I pass better, because I'm sure it will be noticeable that I've been thinking about it for so long?

In Sweet & Spicy, the super joker is added, which can be any spice and any number. It is therefore always correct and cannot be doubted.

—description from the publisher

Whole title: "Durch Kampf zum Sieg, Original-Hakenkreuz-Gesellschaftsspiel“ (eng. "Through struggle to victory, Original swastika parlor game") made by Verlag August Haug, Berlin.

Game rules similar to game "Mensch ärgere dich nicht!", which is German version of Pachisi. Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board (this game is unique because the game boards layout is similar to swastika). The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

Face off in the ultimate Pop! battle! Combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Move through memorable locations — Dracula’s Castle or Frankenstein’s Laboratory — and use your characters’ unique abilities to capture points and achieve victory!

—description from the publisher

In Chemical Overload, the current Master Alchemist is set to retire, but has been preparing for this by training his apprentices for years. Sure, the Academy of Alchemy has been pretty brutal so far, but the end of the road is near. The final exam is going to be rough, but it’ll be worth it, if you manage to rise above your fellow students and win the title of Master Alchemist!
At the end of the final exam, you’ll be judged on the quality of your potions, which can be measured by how many Alchemy Points you’ve managed to accrue. Do this before the lab fills up with too many toxic fumes and the exam is called to a halt.

You and your fellow students will start with the same basic chemicals and flasks. You’ll be combining your chemicals with the flasks of the correct size to brew magical potions.

Each potion has its own effects and Alchemy Point values, and you’ll be able to use those potion’s effects throughout the game to help you gain more gold, alchemy points, more powerful chemicals, or even more powerful potions!

But some potions will also add to the amount of toxic fumes in the lab! There are several thresholds, that once passed, you’ll have to draw a toxin card and deal with those effects. So you’ll want to keep an eye on that track, because once the tracker hits the end of the meter, the test is over!

At the end of the final exam, the alchemist with the most Alchemy Points wins and is crowned the Master Alchemist!

Chemical Overload is a Deck Building game that has elements of tableau building as well. On your turn, you’ll have a hand of cards. Any flask cards in your hand can be played to the table and remain there until used to brew a potion. There are also potions that can be played to the table for ongoing effects.

As a bit of a twist on a classic deck building game, when a player gains new cards, such as new chemicals or a newly brewed deck potion, those cards go right on top of their draw pile. Any flasks or table potions gained can be placed immediately in the players tableau area. Players will be able to decide what unused cards in their hand they want to keep at the end of the round and which they want to discard, all with an eye on the cards they know they’ll be drawing next turn.

Chemical Overload is for 1-4 players and takes about 45-60 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

Goblins have come to the town of Sandpoint, intent upon stealing their fireworks for an upcoming festival. Do you have the goblin grit to pillage your way to victory and emerge from the town with the most fireworks?

The game is played over a number of rounds. Each round, every goblin takes a turn pulling a loot token from the town's treasure pile. These tokens might represent useful tools or valuable treasure like fireworks, dogslicers (goblin knives), or shields. Unfortunately, the tribe's most fearsome beast, a pig called Squealy Nord, is also hiding in the treasure, bringing mayhem and chaos to any who draw his token from the pile. You never know what you might get.

Fighty goblins can choose dogslicers and just steal from their neighbors instead of raiding the village. Smart goblins will take some shields to defend themselves from their peers. Crafty goblins with leadership qualities may choose instead to take the badge of leadership, the Pickle Token, signifying for all their prominence and importance as well as the right to pick first next time.

After 10 rounds and one last free for all opportunity to steal from each other on the way back home, one goblin is declared the "bestest goblin of the raid" and basks in glory and the admiration of their peers. Until the next raid...

—description from the publisher

Before preparing for the dive you receive some objectives to locate the areas of some animals and others to avoid. Who will be able to complete it first?

Abstract board game of 18 cards for two players where we will carry out an underwater expedition through the Mediterranean. Players must form a common sea of â€‹â€‹cards in which different sea creatures will appear or hide, scoring for each one in a different way.

The game is played to the best of three rounds and the first player to reach ten points will be the winner of each of them.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Antes de prepararos para la inmersión recibís unos objetivos para localizar las zonas de algunos animales y otras a evitar ¿Quién será capaz de completarlo antes?

Juego de mesa abstracto de 18 cartas para dos jugadores donde realizaremos una expedición subacuática por el Mediterráneo. Los jugadores deberán formar un mar común de cartas en el que irán apareciendo u ocultandose distintas criaturas marinas puntuando para cada uno de distinta manera.

El juego se juega al mejor de tres rondas y el primer jugador en alcanzar diez puntos será el vencedor de cada una de ellas.

—description from the publisher

Way Too Many Cats is a competitive drafting spatial puzzle game about drafting cats, making each cat happy, and pressing your luck in the number of kittens you take on.

Players are managers of an adoption agency trying to show off each cat in the best light. They accomplish this differently depending on the cat type and the individual characteristics of each cat.

The game is played until one player fills all showcase spots in their adoption center; all players get equal turns and the player with the cutest cats wins!

—description from the publisher

Transform an unsustainable suburb into a diverse, affordable, and walkable town. Remove single-family housing limits to let the citizens build, then connect buildings with streetcar lines of your own color to score points.

What is uniquely awesome about this game?

     Minimalist crayon rail game with 1-page rules on the scale of a town rather than a continent.
     The town is procedurally generated in 3D as the game progresses.
     Transform an unsustainable suburb into a diverse, affordable, and walkable town.


Streetcar Suburb has no luck or hidden information, and rewards strategic play. The randomized setup is neutral to both players, ensuring that every game is both unique and fair.

—description from the designer

Play as girls attempting to gain a harem. Draft cards of various levels of strength with unique effects to form your hand and battle other players, winning the affection of various girls to build your harem. Over three rounds, each player plays a card from their hand. After resolving all effects, the player with the highest strength gains the girl targeted that round. At the end of the third round, the player with the most girlfriends wins the game.

Tech Exchange is a multi-player, real-time trading card game for 2-6 Players. It uses a modern deck of cards called the Tech Deck. Each card in the Tech Deck represents stocks in companies that players trade. As players trade cards and use card abilities, the stock market gains value. Each stock card has card abilities that players can use during two turn-based effects rounds. Players score victory points based on the value of their final hand after all trading is completed. Players are trying to collect sets of triples, quadruples and a flush (cards that share a domain/suit).

REAL TIME TRADING – The players trade cards from their hands between each other in real-time. There are no turns and trading happens simultaneously between players following a few trading rules.

USE CARD EFFECTS – When a stock stack hits a value of three or no one wishes to trade anymore, trading pauses. Then, players take turns using effects on the cards in their hand. Trading continues. After all trading has completed, there is a second use effects round.

STOCK SCORING – After the second use card effects round, players tally up victory points based on the value of card groupings in their hand and the value of the stock market.

WINNER – After three rounds of play, the player with the most points is the winner. If tied, players share the victory.

TECH DECK AS A GAME SYSTEM - The Tech Deck is a modernized deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker, Tech City which are other games that use the Tech Deck.

—description from the designer

The Kingdom of Havresac has been stricken with a terrible curse, and only your team of guardians can liberate it. Gather glory, gold and victory points to become the most bravest defender of the kingdom.

All members of your team of guardians are kept in your bag, each with their own special role and ability. On each round, successively draw your guardians from your bag and use them on your own kingdom board in order to rebuild villages, fight off monsters, free fairies in time, open treasure chests… Each guardian you play allows the next to go further out in the kingdom in order to reach the places you aim, if you plan adequately. Your heroic acts grant you points for the final victory, but also gold to recruit new guardians, building up your bag and refining your strategy.

—description from the publisher
The Olympic Games is a card game similar to belote. By winning tricks, you progress on different tracks which represent events (high jump, 100 meters, long jump, marathon...).

Orichalque is a tense and fast-pace strategy game – similar to a short 4X. Each player has their own Island board to explore and develop. On each turn, they choose a set of one Exploration tile and one Action : recruit hoplites, produce precious orichalcum (a legendary metal from Greek mythology), construct buildings granting powerful bonuses, or try to get rid of Monsters infesting your island (and preventing you to build new building).

To prevail, you will need to erect majestic temples, forge orichalcum tokens or win the favors of titans (by creating areas of their favorite landscapes. The first to get to 5 victory points while clearing their Island of all Monsters wins the game.

—description from the publisher

The Lineup is set and it’s time for you to identify your friends!

In Lineup, you’ll be asking the group questions that have a numeric answer. Then, you’ll create a lineup of your friends based on how you think they’ve answered! The most accurate predictor wins!

Lineup is based off the smash-hit CUT show with over 1.2 billion views to date!

—description from the publisher

From the creators of What Do You Meme?

Match the funniest caption to the photo to make your own Meme!

The goal of Family Meme Night is to win the most Photo Cards by coming up with the funniest Caption Card/Photo Card combos. The target number of Photo Cards needed to win varies by the number of players.

UeStop! is a competitive word game where players test their knowledge and their reflexes, struggling to be the first one to find the correct word with the correct letter.

The game is played in turns and in each turn there is a card with one of the four possible colors (green, yellow, red, blue), also showing 4 categories on four edges of the card and 4 different letters in the middle of the card. These 4 letters are presented in colored bubbles, matching the colors of the cards.

After all the players have read the categories and are ready, another card is opened and then, the players will try to be the first one to put their hand over the card and say one word with the starting letter indicated on the colored bubble of the second card that matches the color of the first card.

If the player answers correctly, she gains the card as a reward worth one point. Another turn starts and the game continues until any player gets 5 points.

This is the basic way to play UeStop!, but the game also contains 3 new game modes that will challenge the players with new rules and adding strategy to the gameplay.

—description from the designer

Greatly inspired by the Cirque du Soleil imagery, MimocirQ brings you irresistable cards featuring a cast of zany characters in dazzling colours!

To collect the most sets of three identical cards, you will need to make the facial expression of body position shown on the wanted card.

Sounds easy? Try it and see... without bursting into laughing.

Pizza Master Revised Edition is a 2-5 players strategy game.

Each player is a trainee in the “Pizza Wizard” to prove themselves worthy of “The Next Pizza Master” title.

Pizza Master starts by taking orders from customers, buying, and stocking up on quality ingredients for your dishes. However, every trainee works in the same kitchen. So if you have your eye on you may be snatched up by other trainees at any time! And you will be punished for any leftover! Finally, The player with the most reputation points wins the title of “The Pizza Master”

Pizza Master Revised Edition has the new rule to easier understand, expanded menu, and more daunting challenges. Moreover, the kitchen has been renovated for the exciting showdown!

—description from the publisher

It is cold. Snow melts on the skin. Winter has come. Suddenly you find yourself in an ice-blue world full of knights, alchemists and long-forgotten creatures. Start your story on December 1 and behind each door find out which door you need to open next. The mystery of sabotaged festivities and an ancient castle are waiting to be explored. Riddles must be solved and shady items like Rubik's cubes or puzzle pieces must be combined to reach the end of the story. Will you find the exit to escape the Escape Room by Christmas? Find out!

-description by the publisher

"I’m only in this for the money“, „I don’t have photograph for you today“ and dramatic slo-mo of tearstruck faces – you know what that‘s about: Common phrases and events from reality TV (or lovingly called „Trash-TV“).

Created by Trash-TV expert @anredo this game serves as a companion for most reality tv shows, where you play along to find out who can get rid of the most cards. Whenever a quote or event happens on the show or at home in your living room, that you just happen to have on one of your cards, you may get rid of that card.
Examples include "someone uses a sob story about a bad relationship with one of their family members" or "someone adjust the volume on your device at home".

The player who manages to get rid of all their cards first wins. If at the end of the show no one managed to lose all their cards, the player with the fewest cards wins.

EscapeBox is a board game that provides you with an exciting escape room experience. You can think with your friends, family or co-workers, put together clues, find a way out of the predicament you are in, and complete your mission. You do not have a simple task ahead! You have to be focused and precise.  Even things that seem very trivial may help you.  Be aware of time!  You do not have much time to complete this mission.

Virus is the name of your first mission. The world needs your help to prevent a human catastrophe.  To succeed in this mission, you have to overcome many challenges and obstacles.  You and your teammates must be able to decipher many locks by solving various puzzles. You only have 75 minutes to save humanity.

Are you brave enough to embark on a mysterious adventure? Then brace yourself and enter the Moriarty estate. The 24 DAYS ESCAPE Advent Calendar ensures an exciting Advent season not only for Sherlock Holmes fans. This special Advent calendar consists of 24 doors with an exciting story, 24 puzzles and mysterious objects as well as the 3D mansion of Professor Moriarty - arch enemy of Sherlock Holmes - to set up and explore. Solve the puzzles around the mysterious mansion and find all the mysterious items to solve the big master puzzle on December 24th.

- description by the publisher

Warning! The siren has just sounded in the fire station because a fire has just broken out! Can you arrive in time in the co-operative game Pin Pon! to help the firefighters and put out the flames to save the burning house?

A 2-player abstract game played on a chess-style board, where opposing pieces (of three distinct kinds: cubes, pyras and tetras) seek to win by capturing the fourth and leader piece of each army: the sphere.

Each piece moves exactly as many squares as it has corners: tetras move three squares, pyras five and cubes eight. No pieces can be jumped, but pieces are captured when an opposing piece ends its' move on the same square. When a sphere is captured, the game is over.

"I need just a few XP to hit level 20. There better be some kobolds down there!" Here you are, minding your own business with some of your best friends, enjoying the leftover scraps buried in the filth of your cave, when you hear a human curse as they knock some rocks free and then you hear the most terrifying words you've ever heard. Words spoken of in legend. You thought they were just a myth to scare young kobolds into obedience.

In Pathfinder: Level 20, players take on the role of kobolds in their den, scampering away from a 19th level fighter who needs only five XP to hit level 20. They will stop at nothing until they kill a few kobolds and hit that magical gateway that leads them to near divine levels of power.

On your turn, you play cards to help avoid the fighters, run away, and do everything you can to put obstacles (or other players!) between yourself and the humans. Your goal is to not be the kobold at the end of the fighter’s sword, with the game ending either with one surviving player or else with the fighters being forced to flee in shame!

A special version of the popular game Lotti Karotti (Funny Bunny). This version icludes 3 new features (bridge, gate and mole) as well as shiny bunny miniatures.

The first player to get one of their bunnies to the top of the hill wins. Each turn players draw a card which either has them move one of their bunnies or rotate the carrot at the top of the board which will cause holes to open and close on the game board. Any bunny that lands on an open hole, or has a hole open up underneath them, drops under the board. If a player loses all 4 of their bunnies, they are out of the game.

Mythic Mayhem: Forge of Heroes is the core game release from the Mythic Mayhem saga. A battle card game with heroes like Rangar the Barbarian and Kieran Darkheart the Wizard, among others. There are 87 unique cards with a total of 250 playing cards within the deck, perfectly balanced for play for 2+! Some cards are rarer to have in your hand than others, so play them wisely!

This card game has one sole purpose, to play! We took all the elements of the most popular trading card games and made it simple and affordable for anyone to start playing. You do not need to know complicated deck building systems or spend hundreds of dollars on trying to get the best cards. Perfect for playing with friends or family, anyone can learn quickly. All the cards needed to play the game are within the game box!

Mythic Mayhem challenges and changes the definition of trading card gaming. Recently, there has been a disconnect between collectors and players and this game brings everyone together. With exceptional art, holographic legendary cards, and smooth game mechanics we hope to reach as many players as possible!

There are Heroes, spells, attacks, defense cards, and more! This is a game of skill, strategy, and chance. We are dedicated to the creation of a smooth, entertaining, and intriguing game that can be played round after round with various outcomes!

Setup

1.  Shuffle the cards; Place all cards face down, instant cards and battle cards in separate decks 
  2.  Each player starts with 20 life points
  3.  Each player draws 8 cards from the battle deck
  4.  Each player rolls the die. The highest roll starts; turns go in clockwise order

Details

1.  One card can be played per turn, unless otherwise stated on specific card
  2.  Cannot heal for more than starting life points, unless otherwise stated on specific card 
  3.  A card can be played toward any opponent, unless otherwise stated on specific card
  4.  Cards are played face up in front of the player until the card mechanics have played out; then discard card to the graveyard
  5.  Defense cards can be played anytime to defend against damage if the defense card is a reaction; otherwise, it is played for turn; A defense 
      reaction does not count for turn
  6.  One defense card can be active per player
  7.  If defending, any remaining damage not defended is taken
  8.  Instant cards must be played at time of pulling; instant card effects and damage cannot be blocked
  9.  A player cannot draw an instant card two turns in a row
  10. Instant cards have a separate playing deck and graveyard than all other cards
  11. If a player uses all 8 cards in their hand; add 2 life points and redraw 8 cards
  12. If there are no available cards in the battle deck or instant deck, shuffle all of the graveyard cards, and place face down to continue the 
      game

Let's Play!

For turn, choose one of the following options

1. Play a damage, defense, or spell card
OR
   2. Draw and play an instant card
OR
   3. Discard 1 card from your hand to the graveyard and draw two cards from the battle deck for your hand

To Win

Deplete all opponents' life points

ãƒ•ãƒ©ã‚°ã®ã„ã‘ã«ãˆ (Flag no Ikenie) is a bluffing and deduction game from Japan.

The game title refers to a character in a movie who is marked for death (flag sacrifice). Like the cop on the last day before retirement, or the young woman hearing a noise in the cellar. You know they are going to get it, you just don't know how.

In the game, these characters are hidden as Prey cards, and players are the villains in horror movies, hunting them. Player hunt by put numbered cards against the Prey cards to reveal them. Cards are played in sequence, and if the total is 6, the player may check the card to see if it is their own target. At 10, the card is revealed to all.

Each hunter has a special ability that helps them catch their targets. But the prey characters also have special skills to resist the hunter and slip away.

The first player to catch two of their targets is the winner.
user summary

In Cursus Honorum you lead your patrician family on a path to power, by occupying all offices in the progression of importance.

Roll your dice and move one of your family members according the number rolled. If it is on the right position, it can stop family members of your opponents.

If you are the first to get one of your family members to "Imperator", the game ends and you win.

Do red bananas feel as blue as yellow strawberries?! Anyone who plays Fruddel Muddel must overlook the muddle of colors in front of them to grab the right fruit.

To set up, deal cards are evenly as possible to all players, then place the four fabric fruits — strawberry, banana, pear, and grapes — in the center of the playing area so that everyone can grab them easily.

Everyone then reveals a card simultaneously, and each card shows the silhouette of one of these four fruits, with an outline in the color of one of these four fruits on a colored background that matches one of these four fruits — which means that each card has elements of three different fruits or two elements of one fruit and one element of a second fruit. Your challenge is to figure out which fruit appears most frequently among all the signals given, then grab it from the center. Alternatively, if you don't want to grab something, place your hand on your deck of cards.

If you grabbed the proper fruit — and more than one might exist! — then you place your revealed card on the bottom of your deck. If you didn't grab a fruit, you discard your card, and if you grabbed the wrong fruit, discard your card and one additional card from your deck. Keep playing rounds until someone discards their final card, at which point whoever has the most cards left wins.

Ahoy, you landlubbers! Dive into a bygone era full of robbery, rum and brawls. 
During a dive you discover a strange box on the seabed. You bring it onto your boat and try to open it. It turns out that there are a lot more secrets hidden inside than you first thought. With the help of a magic shell, you'll witness strange happenings on a pirate ship where little is as it seems. 
So it's all hands on deck: solve the riddles, listen carefully to the radio play and uncover the mystery, box by box.

-description by the publisher
